feed.title: Stories by Atit Bimali on Medium
feed.description: Stories by Atit Bimali on Medium

items.title: Populating Django Website Using an External API
items.author: Atit Bimali
items.description:
An Application Programming Interface(API) is is a way for two or more computer programs to communicate with each other. It is a type of software interface, offering a service to other pieces of software. To understand better about API let us take a simple example. If we consider the internet as a restaurant then the API acts as a waiter who serves us the data we request to the Database/Server like the waiter who plays the role of middleman to serve us the food that is available at the restaurant.

We can use an external or a third party APIs like Google API, News API, IMDB API to populate our Django website. Here I will show you a Django website which will get News Data from News API and render the data the way we want in out website.

I have uploaded the source code on my GitHub.

First of all go to News API and get your API key by signing up or logging in with your Account. Now In your App’s views.py file add the code like this:

https://medium.com/media/8ac38203b7fcfb8ca16991d8a6e4442d/href

Don’t forget to replace the key with your own API KEY

API_KEY = 'your API KEY'

Now to render the data on your Website add the following code in your HTML Template file.

https://medium.com/media/c5801dbbdb25321dec805147bec38961/href

When you start up your server you will be able to see something like this.

But that’s not what we are limited up to, We can even save the data from the API to our Database and use it the way we need. This way we can create more dynamic page by creating a detail page for the item. If you visit the Books section of this website and click any of the Book (uses Google Books API) listed there you will be able to see the detail page of that Book.

Leave a Comment below if you want a guide on making a similar page I discussed above. Know more about me : Atit Bimali

Happy Coding!

It is a type of software interface, offering a service to other pieces of software. To understand better about API let us take a simple example. We can use an external or a third party APIs like Google API, News API, IMDB API to populate our Django website. Here I will show you a Django website which will get News Data from News API and render the data the way we want in out website.

Don’t forget to replace the key with your own API KEY

Now to render the data on your Website add the following code in your HTML Template file.

items.title: Implementation of DDA Line Drawing Algorithm Using matplotlib and Pyscript.
items.author: Atit Bimali
items.description:
In Computer Graphics DDA stands for Digital Differential Analyzer, It is one of the method for scan conversion of line.
Using Matplotlib we can plot a graph of a line for given two x and y coordinates with the help of DDA algorithm. You may check this to learn more about DDA ALgorithm and how the equation is generated.

We can use Pyscript which allows us to run Python script inside an Html file. This is a relatively new Python Framework which was introduced about a month ago. Save the given code by creating an Html file and you should be able to see the website from which a matplotlib plot can be generated.

https://medium.com/media/4af5e2740c9f787659264bd728dcacac/href
